meanings.definition: The act of twisting or bending out of shape.
meanings.sent1: During the circus performance, the acrobat displayed an impressive contortion.
meanings.sent2: The contortion of the tree branches made it difficult to walk through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The contortion of the balloon animal made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her face contorted in pain as she tried to squeeze through the narrow opening.
meanings.sent5: The contortion of the pretzel made it look like a twisted work of art.

meanings.definition: A twisted or bent shape or position.
meanings.sent1: The contortion of the wire sculpture was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: He woke up with a contortion in his neck from sleeping in an awkward position.
meanings.sent3: The contortion of the yoga pose made her feel like a pretzel.
meanings.sent4: The contortion of the road ahead made it impossible to see what was coming.
meanings.sent5: The contortion of the dancer's body amazed the audience with its flexibility.
